description: Build a browser-based collaborative design platform with real-time editing, vector graphics, design systems, and team collaboration - following Figma's revolutionary web-first approach.

frontend.rationale: Figma pioneered browser-based design tools using WebGL for high-performance graphics rendering. Canvas API for vector operations.

backend.rationale: Node.js for web services, C++ modules for performance-critical operations like vector calculations and file processing.

database.rationale: PostgreSQL for relational data, Redis for real-time collaboration state, Object storage for design files and assets.

realtime.rationale: Operational Transform for conflict-free collaborative editing. WebSocket for low-latency real-time updates.

graphics.rationale: WebGL for hardware-accelerated graphics. Custom vector engine optimized for design tools performance.

fileFormats.rationale: Optimized binary format for fast loading and efficient storage. SVG export for compatibility.

questions.text: What type of design platform will you build?

choices.label: UI/UX design (Figma style)
choices.impact: Component systems, prototyping, design tokens, developer handoff

choices.label: Graphic design (Adobe Creative Suite style)
choices.impact: Advanced illustration tools, photo editing, print design features

choices.label: Collaborative whiteboarding (Miro style)
choices.impact: Infinite canvas, brainstorming tools, workshop templates

choices.label: Presentation design (Canva style)
choices.impact: Template system, asset library, brand management

questions.impact: Determines core feature set, tool complexity, and target user base

questions.text: How advanced should real-time collaboration be?

choices.label: Basic collaboration (sharing and comments)
choices.impact: Simple sharing, comment system, basic permission management

choices.label: Real-time editing (Figma style)
choices.impact: Operational transform, live cursors, conflict resolution

choices.label: Advanced collaboration (branching, merge conflicts)
choices.impact: Version control system, branch management, advanced conflict resolution

questions.impact: Affects technical complexity, infrastructure requirements, and development timeline

questions.text: What performance level do you need for design files?

choices.label: Basic performance (small files, simple designs)
choices.impact: Standard web technologies, simple rendering pipeline

choices.label: High performance (large files, complex designs)
choices.impact: WebGL rendering, optimized data structures, performance monitoring

choices.label: Enterprise performance (huge files, real-time collaboration)
choices.impact: Advanced optimization, caching strategies, scalable architecture

questions.impact: Determines rendering technology, optimization strategies, and infrastructure needs

questions.text: Do you need advanced design system features (components, tokens, libraries)?
questions.impact: Requires component system, design token management, and library sharing features

questions.text: Do you need developer handoff features (code generation, specs)?
questions.impact: Requires code generation engine, CSS export, and developer-focused features

metrics.usage: Active designers, files created, collaboration sessions
metrics.performance: File load times, rendering performance, real-time latency
metrics.engagement: Session duration, feature adoption, sharing frequency
metrics.business: Subscription conversion, team size growth, enterprise adoption

risks.risk: Browser performance limitations for complex designs
risks.mitigation: WebGL optimization, progressive loading, performance profiling
Proven operational transform algorithms, extensive testing, graceful degradation

risks.risk: High competition from established design tools
risks.mitigation: Focus on specific niche, superior collaboration features, competitive pricing
Progressive enhancement, feature detection, browser-specific optimizations
Progressive disclosure, onboarding flows, user testing

successFactors: Exceptional performance with large design files
Intuitive interface that doesn't compromise on power
Strong design system and component management
Excellent developer handoff and code generation
